title: StarCraft: Reliving the Rush - Episode 3: A Classic Reborn

json.text: Blizzard is pretty unique in our support of our games.
We should continue supporting as long as people are playing.
That's why the Classic Games is here now.
We are remastering StarCraft because it still has a huge following.
There is so many players out there.
And we'd like to welcome those players
into our current community.
We've taken incredible care remastering this game
because we love it as much as the community does
and we will be damned if we are going to break it.
The most difficult aspect of remastering
has been really going into the source code
it's almost 20 years old now.
It is kind of funny seeing the names at the top of the files
with this is code written by Mike Morhaime or Frank Pearce.
You can see the comradery in the way that they coded
and in the comments that they left.
And actually... the code is really good.
The gameplay section of it is not being touched at all
Nobody even goes into it.
You keep asking yourself: "Have we changed the original game?
Is it fun? Are we adding value to it?"
If the answer is "No", we cut that feature
or we look at a different way of doing it.
We've spoken to all sorts of people
be that professionals or the streamers
or the people who are just playing day to day
to make sure that their experience
is as good as what it was and we can only enhance that.
The game has going to feel and act like it always has.
You still have to micro in the same way.
You still have to build units in the same way
and the strategies that have worked 15 years ago
will also work today.
We want to make sure that as soon as you look at it
you know it's StarCraft.
This is Jimmy.
Sounds fun.
We've had a lot of people that look at it
and their initial thought is like "What have you done?"
And I am like "What do you mean?" and then we show them
the low resolution version and they are like
"Oh my god. I don't remember it like this.
I remember it like the HD version".
We are making sure that the integrity of the look of the game
stays the same.
Tilesets are looking gorgeous, the units are looking gorgeous.
The ability to launch StarCraft from the Blizzard Launcher
and get straight into the game and get straight into the chat channels.
You are playing your campaign and your progress is being saved
and you're finding out where your friends are.
You are getting messages from other people on battle.net
Dynamic Lighting should be really noticeable.
There will be an option, so once you turn it on
it'll change the way everything looks pretty drastically.
The community had ramps, so we decided
one of the things we are going to add, are ramps
and they are going to be any size you want.
You can expend them out. keep them small.
Another great feature is observer mode.
You can pull out and see the whole landscape.
And then you can zoom right in
to each one of the individual battles
so you are up close and personal in the action.
The cool thing with StarCraft Remastered for the professional player
it's still the game that they know and that they love.
We didn't change any of that.
But for the viewer, everything that we put in
has really been there to just help it light up
and make it look fresh and new
and it is more accessable to them.
As much as I think everyone is going to be very excited
to see this up-resed art in 4k
I think the most important element of it is
uniting the classic StarCraft community
with our current community of players.
Blizzard set out to make awesome games that bring people together.
StarCraft Remastered is about carrying this tradition on.
We do this for love the community, we are part of it
and we hope you enjoy.
